intro: Cyclosorus blastophorus, commonly known as the golden bladderworts, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. The plant typically grows in shallow, still waters and is often found in muddy or sandy substrates. Its leaves are simple and filamentous, while its flowers are small and usually white or pale yellow. Cyclosorus blastophorus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microscopic life.
